titleStmt.title: Posterior Consistency of the Silverman g-prior in Bayesian Model Choice

affiliation.orgName: Department of Computer Science & Engineering HKUST

analytic.title: Posterior Consistency of the Silverman g-prior in Bayesian Model Choice

abstract.p: Kernel supervised learning methods can be unified by utilizing the tools from regularization theory. The duality between regularization and prior leads to interpreting regularization methods in terms of maximum a posteriori estimation and has motivated Bayesian interpretations of kernel methods. In this paper we pursue a Bayesian interpretation of sparsity in the kernel setting by making use of a mixture of a point-mass distribution and prior that we refer to as "Silverman's g-prior." We provide a theoretical analysis of the posterior consistency of a Bayesian model choice procedure based on this prior. We also establish the asymptotic relationship between this procedure and the Bayesian information criterion.
